employment
Co-founder / CTO at Fount.in | Rochester, NY [May 2012 – Present]
Artificial Intelligence as a Service.
Coverage: PopSci | Gizmodo | New Scientist | Business Insider | Discovery News | MedicalDaily | Bild.de | SFGate | Fierce Health | NPR (panel round 2, 5 minutes in) | [video] Health Data Palooza Keynote |GigTank Demo Day


Head of Engineering at Simply Home | Asheville, NC [Oct. 2010 – Apr. 2012]
As the chief technologist at SimplyHome, I was responsible for building the infrastructure behind our solutions that allowed families to monitor aging or disabled loved ones with technology instead of live at home caregivers.
  • Restructured and rewrote the distributed systems and cloud architecture
  • Learned about hardware manufacturing through the design of ~12 devices (FCC certifications, hardware tooling, CAD)
  • Heavy scaling and growth focus
Coverage:Extreme Makeover: Home Edition

Founder / President at Scenedipity | Asheville, NC[Apr. 2011 – Apr. 2012]
  • Open data platform for restaurant and foodtrucks
  • Introduction to open source community (specifically Github) and twitter.
  • [Toolkit Growth] CouchDB | Embedded jetty w/ Virtual Hosts | Graphiti | built a URL Shortener (source) & [one in JS!] | tech basis for Fount.in | open sourced http://androwis.com.

Lead Dev / Sys Admin at IWANNA, USA, LLC | Asheville, NC [Jan. 2010 – July 2011]
  • Managed the complete rebuild of a classified website that serves over 25,000 classifieds weekly and generates over 1 million hits a month. The largest developmental focus was placed on the user-interfaces and the networking of the individual advertiser’s classifieds.
  • Proposed/developed an expansion that focuses on and supports socially aware projects and programs in the local community
  • Proposed/developed a marketplace for local businesses to manage and brand their inventories.

Programming Consultant at Bishara Textile Manufacturing Cairo, Egypt [May 2008 – Sept. 2008]
  • Designed an online management tool for a 2000+ worker textile factory. The software manages all aspects of garment production, from worker output and factory capacity to scheduling design calendars while using a database back-end. Resulted in a 12% productivity increase.

Programmer & Draftsman, at Shamburger Design Studio, Hendersonville, NC [May 2007 – Aug. 2007]
  • Web Programmer: created an ftp style page so clients could securely access rendered designs
  • Architectural draftsman for 10 projects in excess value of $15 million
  • Trained a new intern.

Architectural Intern, at Shamburger Design Studio Hendersonville, NC [May 2006 – Aug. 2006]

  • Apprenticed architect through all stages of design, from initial meeting with clients, to sketching the ideas, to final presentation of plans and bidding of project to contractor
  • Draftsman using AutoCAD 2005, archiCAD, and Google’s Sketch-Up.
